Show HN: LetsPY – A Minimal Python Coding Playground
text:
Hi HNers!

Im so exited to release my second product(side project) on HN after one year development and content authoring in my spare time. I hope this project will help young fiends(mostly kids) to get started with coding journey with fun and ease.

This is an interactive coding(using Python language) teach tool which is explaining couple of programming concept using gamification approach. Once learners successfully completed one project through coding practice he would get a reward badge. with these badges accumulation, he would get higher level reward such as coding cheatsheet and game authoring disclosure docs.

Learning how to code is a big challenge for kids, even for smart kids those concept are always abstract and hard to understand. So, I made this tool to help young beginner to lower the doorsill through all possible approaches including game, video, text..and so on. I have great interesting in interactive online learning tools like this. I hope you would like to give a try on this product and find it helpful to your kids.

All feedback and suggestions are welcome!

Do you hide that you suffer from PASC (Long Covid)?
text:
At this point, more than two years from the original infection ( a so-called "mild case" ) I am essentially disabled, yet have found out that saying it out loud if asked why I'm sick or why I can't do this or that, etc, there are mostly two reactions when people hear it.

- They assume I have COVID right now, and I am walking around with the infection. Which naturallly freaks people out.

- They think I'm making things up. At most I may get the occasional "oh yeah, I still get tired myself sometimes..." but still a funny look nonetheless.

Being "tired sometimes" is not being unable to breathe and oxygen levels dropping like crazy for no reason, or having liver failure, or unexpected and sudden hemorrhages, heart disease that came out of nowhere ( 100% healthy and very fit before COVID ) and a million other things which make life very miserable and difficult. In short, being disabled.

And yet people react as if it's made up.

I know I am lucky as anxiety does not cause hemorrhages or unexplained liver failure, or a number of things that happen with this disease. I feel for those with "simple" migraines, or the like, who can't even find "comfort" in a doctor rushing them to the ER because clearly you need to be there right now -- no psychosomatic anything here, you get to the hospital or things get very ugly very quick.

How do you deal with this problem ? Have you been hiding it ?

Edit : Supposedly there is an incredible number of people affected by PASC. In two years I have never met one, no one other than me. It's beyond frustrating.

Ask HN: Does Google employ better software engineers than Apple?
text: I have both the latest Pixel and iPhone devices here and navigating complex apps are equally fast and multitasking is equally smooth on both. It's quite odd how the iPhone is not faster when benchmarks show it has 70% faster performance in single thread tasks. Does Google attract better software engineers who can squeeze a lot of performance out of less capable hardware?

Ask HN: Amazon locked my account and doesn't accept my bank statement
text:
I live in the Philippines and I tried to buy a 65" TV. This is actually my second purchase on the same card. I have never asked for a refund nor used gift cards. They locked my account asking for a billing statement. I used my debit card so I sent them a bank statement (has my name, address, account number), + picture of my debit card with the bank account number. They didn't accept it and they didn't explain the reason properly. I emailed jeff@amazon and address-verification@amazon.com with the documents but they haven't replied since 13 days ago. I already bought the TV from somewhere else, but I really want to get access to my account since I use Audible a lot. What are some last resorts I should do? Is it worth calling them?

Response from Amazon:

Hello,

Thank you for your response. We have reviewed the information you provided but we were unable to verify ownership of your visa payment ending in **** because .. Your account is still temporarily on hold.

You can resolve the issue by signing in to your Amazon US store account again and following the on-screen instructions.

When uploading a document to verify ownership of a payment method, be sure that the name, address, payment type, and relevant transaction information are clearly visible. For your security, only display the final 4 digits of the payment method number.

Please share your information promptly so that we can verify the payment and restore full access to your account as soon as possible.

Account Specialist Amazon.com https://www.amazon.com ================
